turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Night Doc.

turns.speaker: DR. HOFFMAN
turns.text: Drive Carefully.

turns.speaker: GUY
turns.text: Not like 'ol Ben Meeker do something like that.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Sure ain't. Martians could land on Ben's doorstep, all he'd do is spit once and get himself a shot gun.

turns.speaker: GUY
turns.text: Who you calling?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Police station. I ain't closing down with out a good goddamn reason.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: We're going to Ben's. The phone never just rings at a police station.

turns.speaker: GUY
turns.text: No way. No how.

turns.speaker: GUY
turns.text: What the hell did this?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Looks to me like your out of business. Now I want some answers.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Like the last time? How many people killed back then? How many kids?

turns.speaker: GUY
turns.text: Al here lost his boy 10 years back.

turns.speaker: GUY
turns.text: Shit, Earl. It's Ted Holster.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: You dumb son of a bitch, you said you saw Myers.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Okay everybody, listen up. I've got Rachel Corruthers and her sister in the truck, and I'm taking them outta town route 410. State police are on the way. Got that?

turns.speaker: GUY
turns.text: Got it Earl.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Okay, out.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Kido. It's four in the morning.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: I can't sleep.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: What is this? Four nights in a row?  You going for a record here?  The seven year olds insomniacs hall of fame?

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: Do you love me Rachel?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Oh, serious questions tonight.  Of course I love you.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: Like a sister?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Jamie, sometimes it's...

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: Like a real sister?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: We're not real sisters Jamie, but that doesn't mean I love you any less.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: Sure it does.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: I know you miss your parents, its hasn't been that long.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: It's been eleven months.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Your mother used to baby-sit me when I was your age.  I bet you didn't know that.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: Your lucky.  I wish she could do the same for me.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Come on Jamie, lets go back to bed.  Come on Sunday.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Sure it is. I think tonight Brady was ready to make a commitment.  But now my future relationship, my engagement, my marriage, my children, your grandchildren, have all been wiped out because I have to baby sit tonight.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: I'm sorry I ruined everything. If I wasn't here you could go out.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Jamie, I'm sorry. I didn't mean it like that. I can go out with Brady tomorrow night. Its no big deal.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: But you wanted to go out tonight. It's my fault that you can't.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Well tonight we're going to do something better. We're going to go trick-or-treating.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: I don't want to.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: It's Halloween. I mean don't you want to get dresses up in a really scary costume and get some candy?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: How about this afternoon I pick you up from school and we go get ice cream?

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: Double scoops?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Double scoops. Now lets get some breakfast.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: You ready for some Ice Cream?

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: I wanna go trick-or-treating like the other kids.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: But I thought you didn't want to go trick-or-treating.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: The Discount Mart. Can we get Ice Cream after?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: You bet.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: Come on Rachel.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: In a second.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Jamie, what happened?

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: It was the nightmare man

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: He's coming to get me Rachel.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: Rachel, can I go get my costume on?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Yeah, hurry up.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: Come on Rachel!

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Coming.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: I thought you said you were ready.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: I'm ready. I'm ready. Okay, let's go.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Jamie, wait for me.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: This is great Rachel. Come on.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Had enough?

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: No way! Halloween's great. Can we stay out all night?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Forget it kido. We're home by eight o'clock.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: Can we go home soon Rachel?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Real soon, Jamie. Now shh.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Jamie!

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: Oh Rachel!

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: Rachel come on.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: Come on.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: I'm gonna lower you to the chimney, okay Jamie?

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: I can't.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Well try dammit!

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: Rachel!

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: I've got you come on, go down.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: Rachel!

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: What are you doing out here alone?

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: Everybody's dead. I just wanna go home.

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: Oh no you can't. I've just been there. That's the first place he'll look for you. Where's the school house? Where is the school house?

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: We'll hear sirens soon.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: Then we'll be safe?

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: You don't believe that do you?

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: MEEKER
turns.text: Rachel, take your sister upstairs. First door on the right.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Dad, what's going on?

turns.speaker: MEEKER
turns.text: Kelly, I want you to close and lock all the downstairs windows.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: MEEKER
turns.text: Just do it.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: That's all the windows, Dad.

turns.speaker: MEEKER
turns.text: All right. Good Good.  Logan I want you right here by the front door. This is the dead bolt key.

turns.speaker: MEEKER
turns.text: Why don't you go make some coffee.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: All right.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Hi Rachel.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I didn't know you and Brady had anything okay?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: You knew. You just didn't care.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: He's not married. Besides, I've got a right to do what's best for me.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Don't you mean what you do best?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Wise up to what men want Rachel, or Brady won't be the last man you lose to another woman.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: You remember Lindsay don't you?

turns.speaker: LINDSAY
turns.text: Hi Jamie.

turns.speaker: LINDSAY
turns.text: You know Rach, Discount Mart is having a sale on Halloween costumes.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: No. Brady's working there till 6:00 today.

turns.speaker: LINDSAY
turns.text: I know! Don't you want to talk to him?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: I don't want to look pushy.

turns.speaker: LINDSAY
turns.text: You won't look pushy.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Well I don't want to come on too strong. A guy hates a girl to come on strong. Fragile egos and all of that.

turns.speaker: LINDSAY
turns.text: You won't come on too strong.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Well I don't want to seem desperate or anything.

turns.speaker: LINDSAY
turns.text: Fact it Rach, you are desperate.  Your just going to go in and buy a costume for Jamie. Perfectly legit.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: LINDSAY
turns.text: Well do I drop you off at the Discount Mart or the Dairy Queen?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Jamie?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Call me.

turns.speaker: LINDSAY
turns.text: Okay, bye.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Hell of a night.

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: Its not over yet.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Where are you going?

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: The Corruther's house. That's where Jamie lives, that's where he'll go.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Leave Myers for the state boys.

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: The state police won't know how to stop him.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Do you?

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: Maybe nobody knows how to stop him, but I've got to try.

turns.speaker: MEEKER
turns.text: Logan, I want you to stay here in case the family gets back.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Right here, Ben.

turns.speaker: MEEKER
turns.text: You look sharp. You understand?

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: No problem, Sheriff.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: 132 to 133 this is 134.

turns.speaker: MEEKER
turns.text: This is 132, over.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Ben-uh-I just heard about the station.

turns.speaker: MEEKER
turns.text: Go to my house. We'll call the state force from there.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: I'll be there in 5 minutes.

turns.speaker: MEEKER
turns.text: You got your riot gun?

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Yeah in the trunk of my squad.

turns.speaker: MEEKER
turns.text: Go get it.

turns.speaker: MEEKER
turns.text: Get the outside shutters.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: What are we doing?

turns.speaker: MEEKER
turns.text: Making sure that no one can get in here.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Isn't this all a little paranoid?

turns.speaker: MEEKER
turns.text: If you'd seen that police station you wouldn't even ask.

turns.speaker: MEEKER
turns.text: Now I pad locked the back door, this is the only way in and out of this house. You got that?

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Got it Ben.

turns.speaker: MEEKER
turns.text: I'll be out on gateway and I doubt I'll be back before the troopers get here.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Maybe you ought to wait here till they do.

turns.speaker: MEEKER
turns.text: Hey. I got a town full of beer bellies running around in the dark with shotguns. Who's gonna be next? Somebody's wife? Somebody's kid?

turns.speaker: MEEKER
turns.text: I am. Ben Meeker.

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: Oh, Sheriff Meeker, my name is Dr. ...

turns.speaker: MEEKER
turns.text: Loomis. Folks around here aren't likely to forget your face. At least not cops. So what brings you back here after 10 years?

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: Michael Myers has escaped from Ridgemont. He's here in Haddonfield.

turns.speaker: MEEKER
turns.text: That's impossible. Michael Myers is an invalid.

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: He's here, Sheriff.

turns.speaker: MEEKER
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: 10 years ago he tried to kill Laurie Strode, and now he wants her daughter.

turns.speaker: MEEKER
turns.text: Are you talking about Jamie Lloyd?

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: Where ever she is, that little girl is in mortal danger.

turns.speaker: MEEKER
turns.text: Myers has been locked up since before she was born. He's never laid eyes on her.

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: Six bodies, Sheriff! That's what I have seen between here and Ridgemont. A filling station in flames. I'm telling you Michael Myers is here in this town. He's here to kill that little girl and anybody that gets in his way.

turns.speaker: MEEKER
turns.text: Hank, call the troopers and check his story out.  And assuming what you say is true..

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: Its true, Sheriff.

turns.speaker: MEEKER
turns.text: All right, all right. Its true, what the hell can we do to avoid a repeat of what happened 10 years ago?

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: Find this little girl, get her somewhere safe. Call the local T.V. station. Tell them to get people off the streets and behind locked doors.

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: When he makes that call.

turns.speaker: MEEKER
turns.text: All right. Pierce, do it. Lets check on this little girl.

turns.speaker: MEEKER
turns.text: Something?

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: He's been here.

turns.speaker: MEEKER
turns.text: How do you know?

turns.speaker: MEEKER
turns.text: This is starting to spook me.

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: Least I'm not alone.

turns.speaker: MEEKER
turns.text: Is that him? Is that him?

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: MEEKER
turns.text: Oh Christ. Doc...

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: Dear God.

turns.speaker: MEEKER
turns.text: Oh Christ. They wouldn't have given up without a fight.

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: They didn't know what they were fighting.

turns.speaker: MEEKER
turns.text: How can a man do this Loomis? Tell me.

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: It isn't a man.

turns.speaker: MEEKER
turns.text: What is he? Tell me! What the hell are we dealing with?

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: Evil.

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: It was Michael Myers. He's come home to kill.

turns.speaker: MEEKER
turns.text: Let it be Earl. Let the police handle it.

turns.speaker: MEEKER
turns.text: You son of a bitch, you just created a lynch mob.

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: You haven't got a police force! These men may be the only defense you've got.

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: Where's that Deputy?

turns.speaker: MEEKER
turns.text: Be here in a minute.

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: Where's the radio?

turns.speaker: MEEKER
turns.text: Right through the kitchen you'll see the basement stairs.  Brady, you know how to use a gun?

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: How's it powered?

turns.speaker: MEEKER
turns.text: Batteries. I planned the generator for the house next week. I wished I hadn't waited.  This is squawk 79er zero of Haddonfield broadcasting on the state police emergency frequency. Can anyone hear me?

turns.speaker: MEEKER
turns.text: It's over.

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: Yes. Michael Myers is in hell, buried, where he belongs.

turns.speaker: MEEKER
turns.text: These kids aren't likely to forget.

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: They've survived this ordeal, they'll survive it's memory.

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: SAYER
turns.text: Anything for a fellow pilgrim. Sometimes we need help getting where we want to be.  Reverend Jackson Pete Sayer of Dumon County, please to make your aquanauts.

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: How far are you going, Mr. Sayer?

turns.speaker: SAYER
turns.text: Gods Country, Promise Land. Where are you heading Mr..ah

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: Loomis. Haddonfield.

turns.speaker: SAYER
turns.text: Car trouble?

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: Sort of.

turns.speaker: SAYER
turns.text: Your hunting it, ain't ya? Yeah, your hunting it all right, just like me.

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: What are you hunting, Mr. Sayer?

turns.speaker: SAYER
turns.text: Apocalypse, end of the world, Armageddon. Its always got a face and a name.

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: I know that Mr. Sayer.

turns.speaker: SAYER
turns.text: Oh your a pilgrim all right. I saw it on your face back there in the dust. I saw it clear as Breasts and blue suede shoes. Would you like a drink?

turns.speaker: MEEKER
turns.text: Rachel, Jamie. Thank God!

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: What's going on?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Sheriff, what is going on out there?

turns.speaker: MEEKER
turns.text: All right Rachel, you stay by this radio. The state boys will send word once their in route. When that word comes you go tell deputy Logan.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: MEEKER
turns.text: Now you understand?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Uh huh.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Sheriff Meeker, we killed him.

turns.speaker: MEEKER
turns.text: Calm down. Calm down. Are you all right? Are you all right?

turns.speaker: MEEKER
turns.text: Jamie! Get away!

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Don't touch him Jamie!

turns.speaker: BRACKETT
turns.text: Hi, Annie, Laurie...

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Hi, Dad. What happened?

turns.speaker: BRACKETT
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: BRACKETT
turns.text: Someone broke into the hardware store. Probably kids.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: You blame everything on kids.

turns.speaker: BRACKETT
turns.text: The only things missing were some Halloween masks, rope, a set of knives. What does that sound like to you?

turns.speaker: BRACKETT
turns.text: You're going to be late at the Doyles, Annie.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: BRACKETT
turns.text: You're going to be late!

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: He shouts, too.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Why didn't you wait for me?

turns.speaker: LYNDA
turns.text: We did. Fifteen minutes. You totally never showed up.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: That's not true. Here I am.

turns.speaker: LYNDA
turns.text: It's been totally charted.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: We just talked.

turns.speaker: LYNDA
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Old jerko got caught throwing eggs and soaping windows. His parents grounded him for the weekend. He can't come over tonight.

turns.speaker: LYNDA
turns.text: Well, are we still on for tonight?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: I wouldn't want to get you in deep trouble, Lynda.

turns.speaker: LYNDA
turns.text: Come on, Annie. Bob and I have been planning on it all week.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: All right. The Wallaces leave at seven.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: What time?

turns.speaker: LYNDA
turns.text: I don't know yet. I have to get out of taking my stupid brother trick-or- treating.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Saving the treats for Bob?

turns.speaker: LYNDA
turns.text: Fun-ny. See you.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: What's wrong, Annie? You're not smiling.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: I'm never smiling again. Paul dragged me into the boys' locker room to tell me...

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Exploring uncharted territory?

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Shit!

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: I have a place for that.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: I forgot my chemistry book.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: I'M baby sitting for the Doyles. It's only three houses away. We can keep each other company.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Terrific. I've got three choices. Watch the kid sleep, listen to Lynda screw, or talk to you.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Look.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Look where?

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Behind that bush there.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: I don't see anything.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: That man who drove by so fast, the one you yelled at.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Subtle, isn't he? Hey creep!

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: He was standing right here.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Poor Laurie. You scared another one away.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Cute.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: It's tragic. You never go out. You must have a small fortune stashed from babysitting so much.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: The guys think I'm too smart.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Well, home sweet home. I'll see you later.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Okay. Bye.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Why did you hang up on me?

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Annie, was that you?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Why didn't you say anything? You scared me to death.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: I had my mouth full. Couldn't you hear me?

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: I thought it was an obscene phone call.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Now you hear obscene chewing. You're losing it, Laurie.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: I've already lost it.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: I doubt that. Listen, my mother is letting me use her car. I'll pick you up. 6:30.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Sure, see you later.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Bye.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: You still spooked?

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: I wasn't spooked.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Lies.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: I saw someone standing in Mr. Riddle's back yard.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Probably Mister Riddle.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: He was watching me.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Mister Riddle was watching you? Laurie, Mister Riddle is eighty-seven.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: He can still watch.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: That's probably all he can do.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: What's the pumpkin for?

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: I brought it for Tommy. I figured making a Jack-O-Lantern would keep him occupied.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: I always said you'd make a fabulous girl scout.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: For that matter, I might as well be a girl scout tonight. I plan on making popcorn and watching Doctor Dementia. Six straight hours of horror movies. Little Lindsey Wallace won't know what hit her.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: I hate that dog. I'm the only person in the world he doesn't like.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: What's this big, big news?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: What would you say if I told you that you were going to the Homecoming Dance tomorrow night?

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: I'd say you must have the wrong number.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Well, I just talked with Ben Tramer and he got real excited when I told him how attracted you were to him.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Annie, you didn't. Tell me you didn't.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: You guys will make a fabulous couple.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: You'll have to. He's calling you tomorrow to find out what time to pick you up.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Annie!

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Fancy.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: This has not been my night. My clothes are in the wash, I spilled butter down the front of me, I got stuck in a window...

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: I'm glad you're here because I have something I want you to do. I want you to call up Ben Tramer and tell him you were just fooling around.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: I can't.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Yes, you can.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: He went out drinking beer with Mike Godfrey and he won't be back until late. YOU'LL have to call him tomorrow. Besides, I'm on my way to pick up Paul.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Wait a minute here...

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: If you watch her, I'll CONSIDER talking to Ben Tramer in the morning.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Deal. Hey, I thought Paul was grounded.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: He was. Old jerko found a way to sneak out. Listen, I'll call you in an hour or so.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Get him out of here!

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Here, Lester.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Lindsey, Lester's barking again and getting on my nerves again.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: No, he's not.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Annie, Paul's on the phone!

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Lindsey, open the door! I'm locked in the laundry room!

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: You locked yourself in.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: I know. Pull my legs. I'm stuck.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: I'm scared.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Then why are you sitting here with half the lights off?

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Well, come on, get your coat. We're going to pick up Paul.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: I don't want to.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Look, Lindsey, I thought we understood each other...

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: I want to stay here and watch this.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Come with me.

turns.speaker: LYNDA
turns.text: Now... First we'll talk a little, then Annie will distract Lindsey and we sneak quietly up the stairs to the first bedroom on the left. Got it?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Okay. First I rip your clothes off...

turns.speaker: LYNDA
turns.text: You idiot!

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: ...Then you rip my clothes off. Then we rip LYNDSEY'S clothes off. I think I've got it.

turns.speaker: LYNDA
turns.text: Totally...

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: I wonder where they went.

turns.speaker: LYNDA
turns.text: Annie probably took Lindsey out or something. Let's look for a note.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: I can't help it. It just keeps ringing.

turns.speaker: LYNDA
turns.text: And I can't keep you interested?

turns.speaker: LYNDA
turns.text: That's great. Now you'll be too drunk to...

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Just answer the damn phone.

turns.speaker: LYNDA
turns.text: I can't. What if it's the Wallaces!? We'd get Annie in trouble.
